arora_probing_2023.title: Probing {Pre}-{Trained} {Language} {Models} for {Cross}-{Cultural} {Differences} in {Values}
arora_probing_2023.author: Arora, Arnav and Kaffee, Lucie-aimée and Augenstein, Isabelle
arora_probing_2023.paperMotivationText: Prior work has explored potentially harmful social biases encoded in Pre-trained Language Models (PLMs). However, there has been no systematic study investigating how values embedded in these models vary across cultures.
arora_probing_2023.paperContributionText: The authors introduce probes to study which crosscultural values are embedded in these models, and whether they align with existing theories and cross-cultural values surveys.
arora_probing_2023.paperResultsText: The authors find that PLMs capture differences in values across cultures, but those only weakly align with established values surveys. They discuss implications of using mis-aligned models in cross-cultural settings, as well as ways of aligning PLMs with values surveys.
arora_probing_2023.theoryOtherText: Hofstede’s Cultural Dimensions Theory, World Values Survey (both more surveys than theories)
arora_probing_2023.dataOtherText: Questions/Values from Hofstede’s Cultural Dimensions Survey, Questions/Values from World Values Survey
arora_probing_2023.resourcesOtherText: Hofstede’s Cultural Dimensions Survey, World Values Survey
